channel.title: Life beyond ours?
channel.description: There are planets besides ours, stars besides ours, galaxies besides ours, but is there life besides ours? I'm not talking little insects that crawl around, or plant-like things that grow up then die without moving more than a foot. I'm talking intelligent, communicating species out there other than humans. I mean, not every civilization flourishes off of oxygen. Another galaxy could live off of an abundant source of an element that would be poisonous and instant death to a human. It's unpredicatable. I'm just curious about other peoples' opinions. I mean, we've had civilizations that have died out and then we're still here. How did the Native Indians get in America? Did the evolve, just as the Spanish did across seas? Sure, put a history book in my face. I'll put a science book in yours. Our knowledge of our past is based mainly off of guestimations. So what's your guestimation? I guestimate that there are species even on the stars we see that are 100x smarter, more intelligent, more developed, and happier than we are.

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

yakman:

[quote author=_ link=topic=380254.msg2858567#msg2858567 date=1247023718]How did the Native Indians get in America? Did the evolve, just as the Spanish did across seas? Sure, put a history book in my face. I’ll put a science book in yours. Our knowledge of our past is based mainly off of guestimations.

its not based off ‘guestimations’, its based off evidence.
the native americans walked through modern-day Russia and Alaska to get to the Americas. The evidence for this is that archeologists have found remains of their settlements as they moved across the land.[/quote]

I mix my meanings. My actual thoughts are that our guestimations are that of distances, such as lightyears etc. Like exactly how far away a star is based on how it moves. Crazy stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Farmers don’t make crop circles, because that would ruin a big part of their income. It all started as an artistic expression. Not long after that idiots started to believe that the circles were made by aliens.

It’s quite simple to make a crop circle. As jme said, draw it out first and then use ropes. Like the name suggests, they are circular. Find a suitable point and make it the center, then use ropes to measure the distance to a second, third, etc circle’s center.

Here’s an example: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:CropCircleSwirl.jpg

First you see 3 center circles. They form a triangle when you connect the centers. In the middle is a big circle, which is the biggest of all the swirls. To find the center of the second circle after the biggest, just add the half of the diameter of circle 1 and 2. Using a compass you’ll find the exact location of the next circle.

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“dragonfire455, post:36, topic:287602”][quote author=jme link=topic=380254.msg2864571#msg2864571 date=1247370345]

Wow, you’re right! I must be an alien! I’ll turn myself in to the authorities ASAP.

You were sent by the CIA right?

Obama, who must be the leader of the aliens that we secretly share a treaty between, sent him. See, the aliens promised us things (like jobs, and change) if we let them lead our country for four years. Since they’ve been living amongst us for hundreds of years, we let them. How else is a black guy going to be president? Seriously.

Obama is a nigger, not an alien.

But I thought niggers were aliens?

Nope, thats mexicans.

[/quote]Henceforth the name “Illegal Aliens”[/quote]
Aren’t the Japanese also aliens? (moonspeak)

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:37, topic:287602”][quote author=_ link=topic=380254.msg2864273#msg2864273 date=1247358029]

Cain_, crop circles. We can hardly read them; how would a farmer make one of those things? I watched Transformers 2 yesterday, so possibly the crop circles are clues, like when and where they’re going to land :rolleyes:

Easy. A small wooden plank with a rop on each end of it. Drink a few beers and go stomping on that corn. P.S. Transformers isn’t real

Do you really think if aliens were advanced enough to travel hundreds/thousands of light-years, they would only be able to communicate with us through crop circles?

Maybe they came back here and communicated us when we used hieroglyphics and still think that we base communications off pictures. Plus do you really think most farmers can make such intricuit designs?
[/quote]

Yes. I say a team of 4 people and you can have a crazy design done by the end of the night. Draw it out first…

I know TV isn’t credible but I saw a show about people who make crop circles. They made a lot of “intricuit” designs and they were farmers.

It’s not always the farmer who does it. Because that involves wasting a lot of crops. Some people do it for a practical joke to other farmers. Make them think aliens visited…[/quote]

But some of those things are freaking huge. It is rather difficult to know how much corn you’ve pushed over when the corn’s taller than you. Get my point?

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”]A planet advanced enough to visit us? Sure they COULD. But without evidence it’s pure speculation.

Again, speculation.

Even if he somehow blended exactly like humans etc, to speculate that he’s an alien without any evidence is stupid, there’s no reason to think that he is an alien.

That’s really a hasty generalization, there’s no reason to think that, it’s not a proper estimate[/quote]

You seem awful eager to dismiss everybody’s theories.

You wouldn’t be trying to hide anything, would you?

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.description:
@11167 wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:23, topic:287602”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=380254.msg2862246#msg2862246 date=1247246170]

(Yes, I’ve seen it; my friend put a piece of paper on his desk and made this weird noise with his vocal chords and the paper got right up off that desk)

I’ve seen a movie about that once, I believe it was called YOU ARE A FUCKING MORON FUCKWIT.
[/quote]

+1[/quote]

Explain how it’s doable then… I watched as he ripped the piece of paper into fourths then did it. He said he saw it on YouTube, and everyone was harrassing the kid, and he thought he was ridiculous until he tried it himself.

Read full topic

item.title: Life beyond ours?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:18, topic:287602”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=380254.msg2860671#msg2860671 date=1247144780]
Why would they visit us? If they have the technology to travel through space then I doubt they’d visit a planet with dumbasses thousands of years behind them.

Unless they plan to colonise… 'though there is plenty of more planets out there.
[/quote]

Natural resources and slaves. If I was the leader of a planet I’d send ships to every planet that isn’t as advanced as mine, and I’d plunder it of all its resources and enslave it’s population.

It’s the colonial ages all over again.[/quote]

That’s a human perspective. There could be life forms out there made up of gas, transmitting information by passing and merging with each other. The possibilities are endless.

I highly doubt there is anything like a human out there, because the odds of a planet having the exact same conditions and evolutionary path as us is so unlikely it could seem impossible. Not to mention the coincidence of them being around at the same time as our race. Therefore I doubt there are other lifeforms out there with the intentions of colonizing or profiting from space.

And has anyone considered that humans may be the most advanced race in the universe right now? If this was true then it could take 1000s before any lifeforms meet each other. One thing is for sure, they will meet each other, but whose to say it will be us (The human race)meeting someone; we could all be dead by then. And whose to say there aren’t lifeforms on planet out there right now who are meeting each other and discovering other lifeforms.

Earth could be an anomaly on this side of the universe, meaning we will never meet another lifeform outside of Earth (unless of course we go to a whole different segment of the universe). The other side could be completely connecting, where life is a common appearance.

Basically, we just don’t know, but it’s fun to think about.

Read full topic
